questions.label: 1 What brought you to bina?...

metadata.text: What brought you to bina?

poll_options.content: My child deserves the best education out there!
Our lives involves multiple cultures / travel. We want stable, international education.
The local offering is just not a fit for us

questions.title: Intro + Segmentation
questions.transcription: Hey, there. I'm noam from Bina. We are a global mobile full schooling experience for four to twelve year olds that is meant to fit your family everywhere. I am absolutely delighted to see you. But before we start, I have a little question. What brings you here?

transcription_data.transcript: Hey, there. I'm noam from Bina. We are a global mobile full schooling experience for four to twelve year olds that is meant to fit your family everywhere. I am absolutely delighted to see you. But before we start, I have a little question. What brings you here?

questions.label: 2 What kind of engagement do...

metadata.text: What kind of engagement do you think is best for your child?

questions.title: UVPs + edu time
questions.transcription: Thanks. And we're here to help. In classes of up to seven students, your child receives three times the amount of attention they would in a standard private school with full days. Phenomenal educators, live classes and friends from all over the world. Our students score at the top 8th percentile in comparison to UK and US national averages. What were you thinking about? The type of engagement that's right for your child right now?

transcription_data.transcript: Thanks. And we're here to help. In classes of up to seven students, your child receives three times the amount of attention they would in a standard private school with full days. Phenomenal educators, live classes and friends from all over the world. Our students score at the top 8th percentile in comparison to UK and US national averages. What were you thinking about? The type of engagement that's right for your child right now?

questions.label: 3 Does the kiddo participate in...

metadata.text: Does the kiddo participate in after-school activities / local communities?

questions.title: Schedule + Extra activities
questions.transcription: So let's talk practicalities, because it's great for little brains. We teach year round. We divide the year into quarters. Between the quarters. Kids get vacation. We get to work extra hard to make sure that their adventures are exciting. The weeks start on Monday and end on Friday. The days have five synchronous hours of live, active, collaborative lessons with teachers and peers from all over the world. Each group is paired with two educators, and each child gets one on ones to your next no, they don't sit straight in front of a screen for 5 hours. Our days are filled with heptic exercises. They do arts, science experiments, sing, dance, and move around to make sure that they are physically healthy as well. Are they involved in their local community doing physical or other activities.

questions.title: Socialization + "Why close?"
questions.transcription: Of course, socio emotional learning is a huge component of what education is and should be. And generation a is going to need a bunch of very different tools in their toolboxes to be future ready. Some are digital. In Bina, students spend a quarter of their days in proprietary socio emotional learning program. They learn how to discuss their feelings, how to negotiate, how to affect effectively collaborate and other delights. And of course, kids need to smell armpits and play ball. For sure, it's not so clear that it needs to happen during their math lesson. There is very compelling research showing that very big classrooms for very young students is not the best idea for their emotional development. What's important at Bina is that you're never alone. We have a family care team that makes sure and helps you navigate local activities that are best for your child. I assume that you like your little one's clothes. What's your top reason.

questions.title: Family Care + Edu Focus?
questions.transcription: A bunch has changed since we were growing up and we were not educated to educate this way, which is why our family care team is just so awesome. They take you by the hand through every single step of the way. You meet them during your admissions call. Your child does the adventure with them. They onboard you walk you through the tech support, and even after you're in class, they are always on for you. You can consider them as your very own super personal educational experts for any question that comes up. They also help you with this one. What is the educational focus for your child right now? What would you love them to achieve?

questions.label: 6 Are you looking for a...

metadata.text: Are you looking for a temporary solution or a long-term school?

questions.title: Program + Term?
questions.transcription: So your child will get the ability to continue their educational journey into any international school in the world. We cover the US and the UK standards and we're accredited. That makes it easy. Also, every six weeks, the entire school moves from one biome to another. These are habitats like desert or marine or rainforest. All their learning is tied to that theme. It helps them contextualize and analyze the world around them. What we work on is emotional awareness, social awareness and environmental awareness. It's pretty cool. Are you looking for temporary or long term schooling?
